full_summary:
## Foundation Building Repairs, Wood Buffalo National Park

### Solicitation Details

| Key | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Reference Number | CB-6389 |
| Solicitation Number | 5P468-23-0073/A |
| Deadline | July 6, 2023, 4:00 PM MDT |
| Expected Contract Date | July 4, 2023 |
| Expected Contract End Date | September 30, 2023 |

#### Project Description

Parks Canada requires a contractor to repair a foundation bulge in the Fort Chipewyan office. The scope of work includes excavation, shoring, demolition and removals, repair work (including interior finishes and building envelope) and backfill. This project is estimated at a value between $100,001 and $250,000, taxes extra.

#### Requirements and Exclusions

* Soumissions received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to bid solicitations is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

#### Security Requirements

* The contractor's personnel and subcontractors requiring unescorted access to a worksite or sensitive assets must hold a valid Reliability Status, granted or approved by the Parks Canada Security Directorate.
* Sensitive assets include cash, artefacts, firearms, explosives, keys, vehicles, historic sites, and electronic equipment.

#### Bidders' Conference

A bidders' conference will be held via teleconference on June 19, 2023. The conference will begin at 11:00 AM MDT. Bidders are requested to communicate with the Contracting Authority before the conference to confirm their presence.

#### Enquiries and Information

All enquiries of a technical and contractual nature should be submitted to the Contracting Authority. Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and received no later than five (5) business days prior to the deadline.

#### Contract and Delivery Requirements

* The contractor shall perform and complete the work no later than September 30, 2023.
* The period of contract is from July 4, 2023, to September 30, 2023.
* The contractor should ensure provision of specific and agreed upon benefits for Indigenous People and Indigenous Businesses in the Area of the Contract.

#### Important Instructions

* Bidders
